markdown.markdown:
{{< qrcode https://github.com/psicostat/4ms-winter-school >}}
***Monday*** Dorothy Bishop - How our Brains Make it Difficult to Think Like a Scientist / Understanding how cognitive biases affect research [[pdf]](slides/bishop-2025_WinterSch.pdf){target=_blank} Daniel Lakens - Which research is valuable enough to do well? [[pdf]](slides/Lakens_4M_17-2-2025_research_worth_doing.pdf){target=_blank} Daniel Lakens - Concerns about Replicability, Theorizing, Applicability, Generalizability, and Methodology across Two Crises in Psychology [[pdf]](slides/Lakens_4M_17-2-2025_two_crises.pdf){target=_blank} Filippo Gambarota - Open Science Starter Pack [[pdf]](slides/open-science-starter-pack.pdf){target=_blank} ***Tuesday*** (*Interview with researcher [[video]](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZaNtz76dNSI){target=_blank>}*) Daniel Lakens - The benefits of preregistration and registered reports [[pdf]](slides/Lakens-4M-18-2-2025-Preregistration.pdf){target=_blank} Jessica Flake - Measurement not schmeasurement [[pdf]](slides/Flake-Measurement-not-Schmeasurement-WS.pdf){target=_blank} Jessica Flake - Measurement and the next generation of open science reform [[pdf]](slides/Flake-Next-Generation-Methodological-Reform.pdf){target=_blank} Jessica Flake - Materials for students [[zip]](slides/Flake-Materials-for-Students.zip) - Additional article [[pdf]](papers/Gehlbach-and-Brinkworth-2011-Measure-twice.pdf){target=_blank} ***Wednesday*** Ettore Ambrosini - From Noise to Insight: Improving neuroimaging measurement for credible and reproducible neuroscience [[pdf]](slides/4M_Ettore_ToShare_WS.pdf){target=_blank} - see also the [recording](https://mediaspace.unipd.it/media/4M_EttoreAmbrosini/1_q6tva30n){target=_blank} Lisa DeBruine - Big Team Setup [[link]](https://debruine.github.io/big-team-setup/){target=_blank} Lisa DeBruine - Coding Club: Creating an R Package [[link]](https://psyteachr.github.io/intro-r-pkgs/){target=_blank} - see also [demopkg](https://psyteachr.github.io/demopkg/){target=_blank} ***Thursday*** Ulrich Schimmack - Theoretical Factor Analysis [[pdf]](slides/Schimmack-Padua-Winter-School-25.pdf){target=_blank} Giulia Calignano - Multilab and Multiverse: from preprocessing to data analysis [[pdf]](slides/4Ms_Multiverse_calignano.pdf){target=_blank} Giulia Calignano - additional materials: OSF repo [[link]](https://osf.io/bhuxf/){target=_blank} Livio Finos - PIMA: Post-selection Inference in Multiverse Analysis [[pdf]](slides/Finos-PIMA-ws.pdf){target=_blank} Livio Finos - additional materials: PIMA dataset [[html]](slides/pima_dataset.html){target=_blank} / GitHub repo [[link]](https://github.com/livioivil/pima){target=_blank} ***Friday*** Massimo Grassi - Do musicians have better short-term memory than nonmusicians? A multi-lab study [[pdf]](slides/Grassi-MusiciansMultilab-WS1.pdf){target=_blank} Filippo Gambarota - A multi-lab study: Power analysis and data management [[pdf]](slides/multilab-grassi-power.pdf){target=_blank} ***Follow up*** Ettore Ambrosini - 2^nd^ part / "extra" lesson on From Noise to Insight: Improving neuroimaging measurement for credible and reproducible neuroscience (2025-02-26) [[recording]](https://mediaspace.unipd.it/media/4M_EttoreAmbrosini_Round2/1_cc4hw7qr){target=_blank} ## Group Activities ### Measurement #### Group 1 @Elson2023-iw [[pdf]](papers/Elson%20et%20al.%202023%20-%20Psychological%20measures%20aren't%20toothbrushes.pdf){target=_blank} — In addition: Select a psychological construct (e.g., cognitive load, word recognition, intrinsic motivation), and compare how five published studies measured it; consider differences in operationalization, scoring, and standardization, and suggest the impact that this variability may have on replicability. - Zofia Dobrowolska - Louie Lei Wang - Stefano Dalla Bona - Giulia Moncalieri - Rocío Vizcaíno-Cuenca - Michela Forcella #### Group 2 @Stapleton2016-el [[pdf]](papers/Stapleton%20et%20al.%202016%20-%20Construct%20meaning%20in%20multilevel%20settings.pdf){target=_blank} - Lu Zhang - Yara Alnajjar - Lucrezia Guiotto Nai Fovino - Caroline Böhm - Cemre Çınar ### Meta-Research #### Group 1 @Ulrich2020-rk [[pdf]](papers/Ulrich%20and%20Miller%202020%20-%20Questionable%20research%20practices%20may%20have%20little%20effect%20on%20replicability.pdf){target=_blank} - Rrita Bajraktari - Giulia Paludo - Fabrizio Visconti - Francisco Miguel Soler Martínez #### Group 2 @Fried2020-oe [[pdf]](papers/Fried 2020 - Theories and models - What they are, what they are for, and what they are about.pdf){target=_blank} - Raphael Merz - Ruben Lamers James - Elena Rinallo - Andreas Voldstad - Benjamin Kunc ### Multi-Lab @Byers-Heinlein2020-pa [[pdf]](papers/Byers-Heinlein%20et%20al.%202020%20-%20Building%20a%20collaborative%20Psychological%20Science%20-%20Lessons%20learned%20from%20ManyBabies%201.pdf){target=_blank} #### Group 1 - Stefano Ioannucci - Yashiv Seetahul - Sana Rehmat - Giulia Brizzi ### Multiverse #### Group 1 @Steegen2016-gx [[pdf]](papers/Steegen%20et%20al.%202016%20-%20Increasing%20Transparency%20Through%20a%20Multiverse%20Analysis.pdf){target=_blank} - Marco Roccato - Isabella Mariani Wigley - Miłosz Kalinowski - Clara Alameda #### Group 2 @Del_Giudice2021-nm [[pdf]](papers/Del Giudice and Gangestad 2021 - A traveler’s guide to the multiverse, pitfalls, and a framework for the evaluation of analytic decisions.pdf){target=_blank} - Marco Badioli - Ettore Napoli - Marta Paź - Victor Auger - Alice Tupinier
